pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.14: Sp 2.941: _Saññattibahulā; divasaṁ mahājanaṁ saññāpayamānāti attho. … Viññattīti hetūdāharaṇādīhi vividhehi nayehi ñāpanā veditabbā, na yācanā._ “_Saññattibahulā_; the meaning is they are trying to persuade crowds of people during the day. … _Viññatti_: not to be understood as asking for things, but as making known by various methods consisting of reasons, examples, etc.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.7: _Anupasampannaṁ_ could in theory be either male or female, but since the rest of this permutation series uses the feminine gender, I take it that the feminine is to be understood here as well.
